data.title: Arkansas State Capitol, Government Building in Little Rock, AR
data.meta_description: The Arkansas State Capitol is a neoclassical building constructed between 1899 and 1911. It is made of Arkansas granite and features bronze doors and chandeliers crafted by Tiffany's. Visitors can take guided or audio tours of the Capitol and explore the test gardens with fifty-one varieties of roses. The venue is handicap accessible and located at 500 Woodlane Avenue, Little Rock, AR 72201. The Capitol is a significant historical site and houses the legislature and staffs of six out of Arkansas's seven constitutional officers. It also has numerous monuments honoring various individuals and events, including the Little Rock Nine, fallen law enforcement officers and firefighters, Confederate soldiers, and Medal of Honor recipients.
